did.head: Descriptive Summary

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Duke University. Office of Student Activities and Facilities.

did.unittitle: Office of Student Activities and Facilities records 1936-2006
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The Duke University Office of Student Activities and Facilities (OSAF) serves as a liaison between the university administration and student groups, clubs, and organizations.

The Office of Student Activities and Facilities Records, 1936-2006, contain correspondence, charters, directories, annual reports, financial statements, and other information on Duke University student organizations, including Duke Student Government, Associated Students of Duke University, the Undergraduate Publications board, the Duke University Union, and the Office of University Life. The OSAF Records also document Duke University student life more generally, including their social life, customs, and political activity.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

For a period of twenty-five years from the origin of the material, permission in writing from the office of origin and the University Archivist is required for use. After twenty-five years, records that have been processed may be consulted with the permission of the University Archivist.

In accordance with the Family Education Rights and Privacy Act of 1974 as amended, Duke University permits students to inspect their education records and limits the disclosure of personally identifiable information from education records.
Portions of these materials are restricted by donor request.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Office of Student Activities and Facilities Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Office of Student Activities and Facilities Records were received by the University Archives as a transfer from 1978-2006.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Michael Shumate, Julia Eads, September 2012
Accessions received from 1978-2006 were merged into one collection, described in this finding aid.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Duke University Office of Student Activities and Facilities (OSAF) serves as a liaison between the university administration and student groups, clubs, and organizations. OSAF also has an advising component, serving recognized student organizations at Duke University. In 2012, OSAF merged with Event Management and changed its name to University Center Activities & Events (UCAE).

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Office of Student Activities and Facilities Records, 1936-2006, contain correspondence, charters, directories, annual reports, financial statements, and other detailed information on many Duke University student organizations, including Duke Student Government (DSG), Associated Students of Duke University (ASDU), the Undergraduate Publications board, the Duke University Union, and the Office of University Life. In addition to documenting the histories of specific on-campus groups, the OSAF Records provide a wealth of material on Duke University students in general, including but not limited to their social life, political activity, and changing social customs throughout the 20th century.
Arrangement: unless stated otherwise, all accessions are arranged as received, generally in alphabetical order.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Because the Office of Student Activities and Facilities Records contain a sampling of documents from many Duke University student groups that span several decades, the collection complements many others already held in the University Archives. The following is a short but not exhaustive list of related collections that can be accessed at the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library. Additional materials can be found by searching the online catalog for the names of individual groups, university offices, residential houses, and fraternities and sororities.

unittitle.extref: Associated Students of Duke University Records, 1965 - 1993.

scopecontent.p: Officer rosters, correspondence, and financial data for approximately thirty student interest groups and houses. Also included are financial statements for two ad hoc groups apparently formed into reaction to contemporaneous world political events: Fast for Biafra, 1969; and Hungarian Student Aid Drive, 1957. For other generally-related manuscript materials in the Rubenstein Library, see also the Hungarian Revolution, 1956 : miscellaneous pamphlets and clippings.

did.unittitle: Various organizations--officers, correspondence, and financial data, 1957-1970

scopecontent.p: Eight bound volumes of annual reports spanning thirteen years; some volumes combine multiple years, but fiscal years 1937/38, 1938/39, and 1941/42 are not represented. Volumes are generally entitled as some variant of Report of the Office of Student Activities & Report of the Staff of Quadrangle Pictures. Group portraits of Quadrangle Pictures officers are tipped into volumes preceding 1941.

did.unittitle: Annual Reports--Office of Student Activities, Quadrangle Pictures, and other groups, 1936-1949

scopecontent.p: Files on approximately 150 student groups and related topics about campus life. Materials date mainly from 1955-1978, with two exceptions: the folder groups "Student Office-Holders" and "Ledgers (disbound)," both described in more detail at their folder entries below. Arranged as received, except that disbound ledgers have been moved to the end of the accession.

did.unittitle: Ad Hoc Committee of Concerned Students for Muscular Dystrophy--loan agreements, 1974
Appalachian State University: policies for student organizations, 1975
Due to Circumstances Beyond Our Control, 1971

scopecontent.p: Atlanta trips, clippings, DUMBugle (newsletter), marching formations, logos, roster, and general files.

did.unittitle: Financial statements--student organizations and scattered memos, 1970-1971
National Association of Student Personnel Administrators (NASPA)--bulletins and journals, 1972-1976

scopecontent.p: Financial statements, organizational loans, van usage, and various forms and regulations.

Although apparently compiled in 1937, the lists in this folder group cite officers of various clubs and organizations as early as the late 1880s. In addition to documenting the histories of various campus groups, the folders contain extensive demographic data about the student body spanning several decades, since student officers' home addresses are given in most cases. The folder "Class Officers" contains "A Tentative List of Student Organizations and Enterprises, Trinity College and Duke University, 1846-1937," a compilation of some 400 student organizations from the first century of the university's history.
Audited statements, financial reports and procedures, and miscellaneous files.

Copies of leaflets, charts, flyers, organizational papers, minutes, and other documents printed by the Student Activities Office for various student organizations and events. Coverage of campus life is particularly rich for the 1967-1968 academic year.

scopecontent.p: Folder of miscellaneous financial and other information on several organizations, including the Bassett Fund and the Black Student Alliance among others.

scopecontent.p: Acc. UA 82-58 also includes the former UA 81-49. Office files of Carolyn Gray, former Director of Student Activities. Mostly correspondence and financial information about student organizations at Duke.

scopecontent.p: Office of Student Activities and Facilities records include subject files relating to the Mary Lou Williams Jazz Festival (1983), Major Speakers, the Undergraduate Publications Board, Freewater grants, the Kammerer Award, the Blackburn Literary Festival, and adviser training.
Grant applications, proposals, requests, and contracts; approved grants; and history of Freewater.
Grant applications, proposals, requests, and contracts; approved grants; and history of Freewater.

Documentation of the history of the "Hal Kammerer Memorial Award for Original Student Film or Video Production, Duke University." The files contain the annual nominees and winners of the award from 1985-2004, including the filmmakers' descriptions of their films. The first folder in the group documents the establishment and early history of the award, circa 1983-1984, "to recognize outstanding achievement in the art and science of film or video production." [Note: entitled both "award" and "prize" in various years.]
Margarethe Commermeyer, Ed Meese, John Waters, Simon Wiesenthal, Douglas Wilder, Barry Williams, Presidential candidates, and previous years' problems.

Records include materials related to Duke Student Government, the Duke University Union, ongoing campus series such as Major Attractions and Major Speakers, the Office of University Life, and extensive event registration forms and contracts related to the Events Advising Committee (EAC).

Arrangement: Materials were received predominantly unarranged, with some folders batched by campus group, some chronologically, and some in no discernible order. Arrangement is now chronological by fiscal year. Fiscal years 1959-1994, which contain only a small amount of material, are arranged in one group by folder title. Following that, FY 1994-95 through FY 2005-06 are arranged year-by-year, and will be made available to researchers as each successive 25-year restriction is lifted.

scopecontent.p: Variety of materials about the history, specs, andusage policies of Cameron Auditorium, Nelson Music Room, Page Auditorium, Reynolds Theater, Sheafer Theater, and other performing venues at Duke University. Also contains information about various musical instruments on campus, including Duke Chapel's Aeolian and Flentrop organs and the Steinway grand piano used in Page and Reynolds in the 1990s.
Budgets, chairs and officers, endowment and fundraising, and a variety of historical information, possibly gathered for the Union's 40th anniversary in 1995.
